summary: This bill, the "Harmful Algal Bloom and Hypoxia Research and Control Amendments Act of 2025," aims to amend the original 1998 act by addressing harmful algal blooms (HABs) and hypoxia. It focuses on research, monitoring, and control strategies. Key provisions include establishing a task force and action strategy, enhancing federal agency coordination, and increasing funding to address the ecological and economic impacts of HABs in marine, estuarine, and freshwater environments. The bill also includes new definitions, funding authorizations, and a national-level incubator program.
